title: Latest iOS update expands emoji with gender-neutral options plus more animals, foods
text:
CLOSE Buzz60’s Elizabeth Keatinge tells us why there is still no white wine emoji. Buzz60

Let your imagination run wild, iPhone users, you have almost 400 new emoji to play with.

Well, 398 to be exact. This vast addition to the iOS emoji keyboard comes as part of the iOS 13.2 update, which Apple released yesterday. Many of the added emoji include new foods, shapes, and additional variations on emoji depicting people and professions, including a gender-neutral option for a painter, welder, and scientist.

With these new additions, you'll be able to create a vampire scene featuring not just a gender-neutral vampire, but a bulb of garlic. The iOS 13.2 update includes both of these emoji.

Prosthetic limbs and other disability-related emoji will also become available to iPhone users. These include service dogs, wheelchair users, and a hearing aid.

Fifty-nine new emoji are coming to Apple devices (Photo: Apple)

Exotic animal lovers can also rejoice, given the addition of a skunk, sloth, otter, and a flamingo emoji.

The Twitter reaction to these emoji has been somewhat mixed. While there is excitement for the new food and animal emoji, there is also some criticism for the new gender-neutral variations.

the otter emoji 🦦 on my phone looks like it’s been waiting for you to come home to have a previously scheduled argument pic.twitter.com/BYCQtCpMLk — 🌙🧙🏽‍♀️ Practical, Tragic 🧹🔮 (@DiscreetLatino) October 29, 2019

Garlic emoji released just in time to protect us from halloween vampires https://t.co/14T17zR2rH — Princess Peachie (@PeachieAngel) October 29, 2019

Another Twitter user, known as "bey," bemoaned the gender-neutral emoji, because they assume that all gender neutral individuals have a similar appearance.

While variations in emoji skin-tone have been available since 2015, many of the additions to the iOS 13.2 emoji keyboard reflect a continuing trend of inclusiveness.

Emoji and the disabled community: New emoji represent people with disabilities

What is that really? New emoji include 'tiny penis' and 'period blood,' according to the Internet

In March, a petition starting by the dating app company Tinder spurred Unicode, the global organization responsible for emoji standards, to announce emoji depicting interracial couples. The recent iOS update features an array of couples, ranging widely in pairings of gender, skin color, and even shirt color.

According to Emojipedia.org, there were 3,019 emoji in existence as of March 2019. This iOS update includes about a tenth of all emoji available across major platforms.

Follow Kevin Wheeler on Twitter: @kdub_333

Read or Share this story: https://www.usatoday.com/story/tech/2019/10/29/apple-launches-ios-update-398-new-emoji/2495272001/
description: iPhone users have almost 400 new emojis to play with. They include new foods, shapes, and additional variations on emoji of people and professions.
